text: The re.search function scans the string line and returns true if it finds the regular expression defined in the first parameter, ignoring case with re.I.
The ^ character means 'beginning of the line' while the $ character means 'end of the line'.
Therefore, the search function will only return true if it matches there preceded by the beginning of the line, and followed by the end of the line, aka isolated on its own.
You ought to use a regular expression.
The regular expression howto from the Python docs might be a good place to start.
Look up the re module (regular expressions).
re.search with the regex ' there ' is what you want.
